subject: Climate & Environment
title: Anatomy of a Landfill
description: A quick win: understand Anatomy of a Landfill.

hook.text: Modern landfills aren't just holes in the ground. They're engineered containment systems.

buildup.text: Layers of clay and plastic liners prevent toxic liquid called leachate from reaching groundwater.

discovery.text: Pipes collect methane gas produced by decomposing waste. Some landfills burn it for energy.

twist.text: But liners eventually fail. Every landfill is a ticking time bomb on a long enough timeline.

climax.text: The US has over 2,600 active landfills â€” and thousands more closed ones still leaking.

punchline.text: Out of sight doesn't mean out of danger.

options: Toxic liquid that seeps from decomposing waste
